samples.question: Okay, and what is public transport like in your town?
samples.transcript: In my hometown, public transport is actually very efficient because we have all different types of transportation. We have trains, buses, trams, and the metro system. We call it the London Underground in the UK, or the Tube. it is full of different lines and different junctions and interchanges, so you can be sure to get to any destination you want around the capital city.
samples.transcript_original: In my hometown, public transport is actually very efficient because we have all different types of transportation. We have trains, buses, trams, and the metro system. We call it the London Underground in the UK, or the Tube. It's full of different lines and different junctions and interchanges, so you can be sure to get to any destination you want around the capital city.
samples.transcript_cleaned: In my hometown, public transport is actually very efficient because we have all different types of transportation. We have trains, buses, trams, and the metro system. We call it the London Underground in the UK, or the Tube. it is full of different lines and different junctions and interchanges, so you can be sure to get to any destination you want around the capital city.

samples.question: Okay, and how do you think it could be improved, the public transport?
samples.transcript: If I were to improve the public transport in London particularly I would make sure that these rails on public transport trains or tube that they refurbish them a little bit and make sure they not so bumpy and make sure all the wagons are up to date They put on new models and make sure everything clean particularly the stations because the stations can get pretty dirty and there not enough oxygen Do you think people should use public transport more? I believe if the public transport situation is efficient and everyone can get to their own destinations and there is enough stations on these metro systems or enough bus routes, then why not? Of course, it has to be cost effective. If these, if public transport is cost effective, I believe more people would use them and they will have good reason to use them. Okay, thank you very much. We are done with the first part. I am relieved actually.

samples.question: What happened there?
samples.transcript: She almost ran out of things to say, but then Mayan just remembered that she does have to speak for up to two minutes. And he was still looking at me like, go on. Yes, I was like, please, just continue. You only have a few seconds left. So it is very important to complete the two minutes. She just about did it. All right, let us go into some details of. Some useful techniques you use there. First of all, before I go into the, related topic, I would like to say something I think is a little bit more. I think it is quite important for everyone. Now, even though Mernush speaks English as a second language, she thinks in English when she wants to speak English. that is really important. do not translate his stuff. Never do that. Because guys, if English is not your mother tongue, okay, I probably would not have that problem because English is my mother tongue. But, Meen Roshan, on the other hand, she, you know, she thinks in English and she speaks in English. So, when you are, when you are doing that, your structures are going to be more correct and fixed.

samples.question: How do you think in English and not think in your mother tongue?
samples.transcript: Before the test, I would say, listen to a podcast in English. Yeah, that is right.
samples.transcript_original: Before the test, I would say, listen to a podcast in English. Yeah, that's right.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Before the test, I would say, listen to a podcast in English. Yeah, that is

samples.question: Is that a good thing?
samples.transcript: You can warm up your mind. Warm up your mind. And then practice a few phrases, perhaps complicated ones too, if you feel comfortable doing that. So you warm up your brain to think and speak in English and English only. Yeah, and you can also watch a lot of movies, listen to podcasts, not only before the test, but also maybe some years or some months or some days before the exam. If it would just help you think in that language. You would, yeah, you are going to naturally think in English rather than your mother tongue. So that is very, something very important to think about.

samples.question: Anything else you would like to tell me?

samples.question: How can people improve their health?
samples.transcript: Well, that is something that is, I think, a question meant for a lot of specialists. But if I am going to think about how people around us can improve their health, I believe they could do a lot more exercise and watch what they eat. Because everything we eat nowadays is not necessarily healthy. it is very important to keep track of what kind of vitamins and nutrients we are consuming. So I believe it is very important for everyone to look at these things. Have a good time of, just set your timetable. I think it is a very good idea if people set their timetable of how they sleep. Sleep is very important. They say you should get six to eight hours sleep a night. That goes for adults. but in, as far as food is concerned, I would say definitely people should have set meals and watch the timing of their meals and do some exercise. Okay, great.
samples.transcript_original: Well, that's something that's, I think, a question meant for a lot of specialists. Sleep is very important. They say you should get six to eight hours sleep a night. That goes for adults. Um, but in, as far as food is concerned, I would say definitely people should have set meals and watch the timing of their meals and do some exercise. Okay, great.

samples.question: Do elderly people do much exercise in your country?
samples.transcript: Well that a very challenging question in my opinion because I don really look at what old people are doing these days elderly people if I want to speak more formally and politely I believe they do some exercise when they retire So I give an example Like my father he does some exercise He gets up and walks for about five minutes. He goes for a little walk. But then he sits down and he says, I have done my exercise. I strongly think that he could do a lot more of that exercise and actually make it, extend it to maybe 20 minutes. So that is an example of someone who is in their senior years.

samples.question: And Samson, do you think all illnesses can be prevented?
samples.transcript: That is a question that no one can answer in my opinion. Because if you look at what we are going through today, we have helped prevent a lot of illnesses. we have helped treat a lot of diseases. But now we have got new diseases coming out like SARS-CoV-2 or coronavirus. Or you could say that people call it COVID-19 as well. This is a virus that people have not been able to prevent yet, this kind of a virus. But lots of things have been stopped and prevented, like different types of flu, maybe certain types of cancer as well. But I think it is a very challenging activity, and I think scientists really need to look more into what causes diseases. And my last question.
samples.transcript_original: That is a question that no one can answer in my opinion. Because if you look at what we're going through today, we've helped prevent a lot of illnesses. We've helped treat a lot of diseases. But now we've got new diseases coming out like SARS-CoV-2 or coronavirus. Or you could say that people call it COVID-19 as well. This is a virus that people haven't been able to prevent yet, this kind of a virus. But lots of things have been stopped and prevented, like different types of flu, maybe certain types of cancer as well. But I think it's a very challenging activity, and I think scientists really need to look more into what causes diseases. And my last question.

samples.question: Do you think there will be less illness in the future?
samples.transcript: That is something that I find very hard to answer if I think about it just for one minute or a few seconds. But, I think there'll still be, there'll still be a lot of diseases in the future. Because if you look what, like I said in the previous question, what is happening now is that we have, we have managed to prevent a lot of diseases. It would help treat a lot of horrible illnesses. But then you have got the new ones coming about. And diseases, they have this ability to mutate. And it is very hard for scientists and doctors to keep up with. So I do not think we will be able to prevent all diseases in the future if I am going to answer your question, frankly. Thank you very much. we are done with your questions now. Thank you. So let us see what Samson did.

samples.question: What is that?
samples.transcript: It is, Association of Certified Chartered Accountancy. So there are 13 papers in it. you are supposed to complete all 13 to get the certification. So far I have completed four. I am still working on doing the rest.

samples.question: And why did you choose accountancy?
samples.transcript: I wanted to get into CFA, I wanted to become a CFA before, but at the time you could not, you cannot give the exam for CFA. there is a qualification for it as well. so I thought I will go through ACC and then I would jump into CFA.

samples.question: And what career would you like to do in the future, maybe in five or ten years?

samples.question: Did you study history when you were in school?
samples.transcript: I did. I did study history in my high school, but I was not very good at it. I like it now because it is all stories. But back then, because I was forced to like, you know, get good grades and exams, I was like just in there.

samples.question: Do you watch any historical TV programs or read any books about history?
samples.transcript: I do not, unless they are like completely fantasized. I do not watch or read anything that is based on history.

samples.question: And is there any period of history you would like to learn about in the future?
samples.transcript: I would like to learn more about the Mughal Empire. Honestly, it was a very significant time for Indians and like their rule in India. So I would like to learn a bit more about it. I was not interested before, but now I would like to like, just for the cultural part of it.
